title: Veterinary Diagnosis: Cardiac Parasite
hint: A parasitic disease transmitted by mosquitoes

clues.text: Persistent dry cough, especially after exercise
clues.explanation: Adult heartworms living in the pulmonary arteries cause inflammation and irritation, triggering chronic coughing particularly during activity.
Heartworms obstruct blood flow through the heart and lungs, reducing oxygen delivery to tissues and causing rapid exhaustion.

clues.text: Difficulty breathing and increased respiratory rate
clues.explanation: Pulmonary arterial damage and inflammation from heartworms impair gas exchange, leading to labored breathing.
The metabolic burden of parasitic infection and reduced cardiac output cause progressive weight loss even with adequate food intake.

clues.text: Heartworm antigen detected in blood test
clues.explanation: The 4DX SNAP test or ELISA detects adult female heartworm antigen in the bloodstream, confirming active infection.

clues.text: Enlarged heart and pulmonary vessels on X-ray
clues.explanation: Radiographs show characteristic changes including right-sided heart enlargement and prominent, tortuous pulmonary arteries.
